ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Definitely. Portuguese is an extremely useful language to have at your disposal and if you already speak a romance language, it comes fairly easily.
Yes. It is a class that will help you improve your speaking and writing skills.
Good continuation of L1-L2 for students wanting to master spoken portuguese.

Decent class, take it to complete language reqs or if you wish to learn a new language. Portuguese is a great language to back up (and possibly hurt - like it did with me) your knowledge of Spanish or Italian or French. Just make sure it's offered at a reasonable time. It was offered 3:30 - 4:20 this semester, a big pain for clubs, master's teas, IMs, etc.
I would recommend this class to anyone who has a genuine interest in learning a new language. Beware, it is not the same as Spanish!
Good class if you're looking to continue on with Portuguese - you write several essays, watch a film, have guest speakers, and learn about a wide variety of Lusophone countries.
It's a relaxed, fun class that will keep up your Portuguese.
